speaker: June
text: [_v.o._] Well, my husband is always criticising me, because in restaurants I like to listen in on strangers' conversations. I don't know why he makes such a big deal out of nothing.  _Through the window behind Frasier, we see that Roz and Noel have entered the corridor outside Frasier's studio, and are in a heated discussion with various other members of the KACL staff._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well June, I suppose your lack of interest makes your husband feel invisible.  Imagine what it must be like to sit [_takes a glance through the window_] across from someone who's constantly scanning, [_picks up the microphone and turns away from the console to looks through the window_] searching, craning their neck to see... Just what the hell is going on out there?

speaker: June
text: Oh gosh, you're right!  I've been insensitive.  It's just common decency to stay focused on the other person.

speaker: Frasier
text: Huh? [_turns back to his console_] What?  Oh, well, good for you, Jane!

speaker: June
text: [_annoyed_] June!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yeah, well, whatever!  Er, this is Dr Frasier Crane. KACL 780. [_stabs at a button and rips his headphones off_]  _He gets up and leaves hurriedly via Roz's booth.  CUT TO: outside Kate's office. An anxious crowd of KACL staffers, among them Roz and Noel, has gathered.  Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: What is going on?

speaker: Roz
text: [_angry, slaps a memo on the board_] Oh, our beloved station manager decided we're not getting our raise this year!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_furious_] What? [_rips the memo off and crumples it_] This is an outrage!  I have a contract!

speaker: Roz
text: Don't palpitate, it doesn't apply to the on-air talent.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calm_] Oh, thank God.  _He proceeds to straighten out the crumpled memo and pin it neatly back onto the board.  When he has finished, he notices that the crowd is watching him unhappily._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_embarrassed_] I'm sorry... I was being selfish, wasn't I? I, er, feel very ashamed.  It is nevertheless, er, an outrage. It's not a personal outrage but certainly a, a family of man outrage.

speaker: Roz
text: [_tearful_] Frasier, I spent that raise already - on my new diamond earrings!  I love them.  I love them so much, I slept with them!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz, as long as you're doing it for love, it's a step in the right direction!

speaker: Roz
text: Real supportive, Frasier!  We've been getting that raise every year, and now this Nazi in nylons comes waltzing in here and cancels it with some vague crap about corporate belt- tightening.  This isn't fair!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, actually you're right!  Er you, maybe you should tell her what you just told me.  Er, except I would leave out the "Nazi in nylons" bit.  It's not your best icebreaker.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you're damn right we're gonna tell her!

speaker: Roz
text: [_to the crowd_] We've all been here a hell of a lot longer than she has!

speaker: Frasier
text: That's right!  _The staffers cheer again.  Behind Roz, Kate enters quietly from her office._

speaker: Roz
text: She pushes us, we push back!

speaker: Roz
text: She's standing right behind me, isn't she?

speaker: Kate
text: Yeah.  _Roz turns around to confront her, but like all the other staffers, she suddenly becomes mute and cowed in Kate's presence._

speaker: Kate
text: Is there a problem?  Nope?  Good.  _She goes to leave.  The crowd parts to let her through.  Everyone is obviously terrified.  Except for..._

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate?

speaker: Kate
text: [_stops amidst the crowd_] Doc...?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, these people... would like to speak with you.

speaker: Kate
text: No, I'm sorry, I can't talk right now, I've got a meeting. [_turns to leave_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well I-I'm sorry, excuse me?  I think your meeting can wait five minutes.  Now they're a little upset about your memo. I think you should discuss it with them.

speaker: Kate
text: Dr Crane... I wrote the memo, I signed the memo, I posted the memo.  If I had anything more to say, I would have put it... Anybody?

speaker: Noel
text: [_puts up his hand_] In the memo?

speaker: Kate
text: Bravo.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  If she wants to play tough, we'll play tough back. We still have a lot of power here.  Now we could go on strike...

speaker: Roz
text: [_annoyed at them_] Yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, look, you know er, I, I think you should listen to Roz. Every year in exchange for your hard work you receive a five percent raise.  Now, you've fulfilled your part of the bargain; she has blithely changed the deal.

speaker: Noel
text: In the 'hood, they call that "being dissed."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, my streetwise friend. [_to the crowd_] You have a right to stand up for yourselves.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  We gonna do this?  Are we together?

speaker: Noel
text: What's the point?  If we strike they'll just replace us. They only care about the on-air people.

speaker: Roz
text: Aaah, so we'll get their support!  Frasier just said he's on our side!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_unsure_] I did?  Well, well, yes I, I did, I did, yes.  But, heh, my meagre endorsement is, is meaningless without the support of the... other talent.

speaker: Roz
text: [_gleeful_] Did you hear that?  Frasier's gonna get everyone on our side!

speaker: Frasier
text: What? [_reluctant_] Er I, I'd love to, to help, but you know, I'm already in hot water with that woman!  You can't ask me to raise a mutiny against her!

speaker: Noel
text: "The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few or the one."  James Tiberius Kirk, Captain, Starship Enterprise. [_does the Vulcan salute_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Go away, you annoying little man.

speaker: Roz
text: [_imploring_] Please?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thinks about it, then enthusiastic_] Oh alright, alright! You organise your people, I'll talk to mine!  _The staffers cheer and Noel shakes Frasier's hand.  FADE OUT_  **COULDN'T WE JUST STOP EATING GRAPES**  _Scene Two - Frasier's apartment. What looks like a quiet party is in progress.  There are four guests standing around, talking to each other and to Frasier.  Daphne is offering people some food from a tray; Martin is arranging a similar tray on the dining table; Eddie is sitting in The Armchair.  A fifth guest - Bulldog - enters from the kitchen, clutching a beer.  He goes to The Armchair._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_to Eddie_] Hey, beat it.  _Eddie barks at him.  Bulldog barks back.  Eddie scrambles off The Armchair and scurries out of the room, scared._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_to Eddie_] Hey, if you can't run with The Bulldog, stay on the porch.  _He settles into The Armchair.  The doorbell rings.  Frasier answers it to Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_enters and gives a pen to Frasier_] Good evening, Frasier; you left your Mont Blanc in my car, so I... [_sees the guests_] Oh. [_icily_] I see cocktails.  Hors d'oeuvres.  Mingling.  If I were the suspicious type, I'd say you were throwing a party to which I was not invited.

speaker: Martin
text: Feel like a wiener, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Indeed I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_annoyed_] Niles, this is not a party; and dad, that is fourteen-dollar-a-pound andouille sausage.

speaker: Martin
text: Wow.  Means Eddie ate about thirty bucks' worth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, these people are colleagues from the station.  We're here to discuss a labour dispute.

speaker: Niles
text: [_assuaged_] Oh, well. [_to the guests_] Fight on, people! [_to Frasier_] You know, there is no greater friend to the working man than my own Maris.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm.

speaker: Niles
text: Remember, when our stable boy Wakim's appendix burst?  She had him driven back to the border at her own personal expense! _He leaves.  Frasier is just about to close the door when three other guests arrive.  One of them is the excruciatingly camp Gil Chesterton._

speaker: Gil
text: Ah, good evening, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Gil, Sheryl, Floyd!

speaker: Gil
text: Oh!  What a stunning apartment!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Gil
text: The palette is pure, subtle elegance!  The detailing... well, it's inspired! [_examines a statuette_] And the furnishings... [_sees The Armchair and stops in his tracks_] Oh, dear.  Is that a chair?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_trying to smile_] That is my father's chair.

speaker: Gil
text: Oh.  Well... this must be your father!

speaker: Martin
text: Hi - Marty Crane.  You put on quite a show!

speaker: Gil
text: [_pleased_] Oh, you've heard my little programme?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I mean just coming through the door.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_to Frasier_] Doc, doc!  Can we hurry this thing up?  I got a charity event tonight.  She's not much to look at, but what the hell.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, well, since we're all here... Er, now, regarding management's claim of financial distress, I've done some checking around, and I've found that the advertising revenues are up eleven-and-a-half per cent... _He is interrupted by a starstruck squeal from Daphne, who has noticed Gil._

speaker: Daphne
text: Gil Chesterton, the restaurant critic!

speaker: Gil
text: [_takes and bites into a snack from Daphne's tray_] Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I just love those wicked things you say when the food is bad!

speaker: Gil
text: [_picks the snack out of his mouth in disgust_] Well, keep bringing these and you won't be disappointed! _As Frasier continues his speech, Daphne sits down at the dining table, looking slightly pouty._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the KACL personalities_] The wage freeze is unwarranted. It is simply a ploy of an overly ambitious station manager, [_angry_] and typical of this woman!  She has terrorised us, she has tampered with our shows.  It's time we said no to this Princess of Darkness!

speaker: Bulldog
text: I got a better idea.  Why don't we just walk up to Mike Tyson and tell him he talks funny?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_unamused_] What about our support staff?  If we don't back this strike, they may lose their jobs!  They're powerless without our support.

speaker: Gil
text: Frasier, old man, why do they need raises?  You're talking about people who eat corn dogs and nachos.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_annoyed_] That statement is appallingly elitist.

speaker: Gil
text: Well thank you, Mister Everyday People!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, I'm sure we'd all like to help these people, but we need our jobs.  We're working stiffs too, living from paycheck-to-paycheck just like they are.

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, someone's blocking me in downstairs.  Who has a BMW?  _Five out of the eight guests, including Gil and Bulldog, proudly put up their hands._

speaker: Niles
text: A red BMW. [_Two hands are still up_] With a red interior.

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, that's me! _He goes to Niles at the doorway.  Frasier shakes his head in exasperation._

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Gil_] Just give me your key; I'll leave it to the doorman.

speaker: Gil
text: [_at the doorway_] Oh, no no.  I was just leaving.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, I'm going too. [_goes to leave_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_frustrated_] Well... where are your ethics?  Where's your conscience?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Where's your john?  I need to slap on some Canoe. _The other KACL personalities file to the doorway.  Frasier, defeated, slumps onto the couch in despair._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I'm with you people!  To heck with the workers. They're not yours!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, damn right!

speaker: Martin
text: And chances are, after the station manager crushes the little people, she won't come after you big shots.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Right. [_slightly unsure_] Why would she...?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I mean er, supposing she's trying to save money, you're the big ticket items.  Erm, after all this, well, she won't have to worry about the support staff backing you guys up, will she? [_laughs, half to himself_] Oh but no, that's crazy.

speaker: Gil
text: [_worried_] You're not suggesting that... Kate might be coming after our money next?

speaker: Martin
text: [_to the personalities_] No, she wouldn't do that!  She's a peach, right?  Soft as a cream puff.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_ominously sarcastic_] And we all know no-one here is overpaid...

speaker: Gil
text: Suddenly, I'm feeling very Norma Rae. _He shuts the door and, along with all of the other now uncomfortable- looking personalities, returns to the middle of the room.  Frasier, reinvigorated, gets up._

speaker: Frasier
text: Great!  I'll get us some more wine. [_quietly to Martin_] Dad, that was brilliant, using reverse psychology!  I guess living with me is rubbing off on you a little bit.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I guess it's only natural that environmental factors would influence personality development...

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, oh wait I, I hope I didn't hit some long-repressed Oedipal nerve...

speaker: Frasier
text: Very funny.

speaker: Martin
text: Because the last thing we want is for you to be sublimating your anger passive/aggressive...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, alright!  Just stop it, you wise ass!

speaker: Martin
text: [_pats Frasier on the back_] Ha-hey!  Looks like I'm rubbing off on you, too!  _They enter the kitchen.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **THE BLOODLESS COUP**  _Scene One - KACL In Roz's booth, various KACL staffers - including Roz and Noel -- are quietly talking.  Frasier enters from the corridor._

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, people!  I have spoken with the on-air talent, and I...

speaker: Noel
text: [_interrupts_] Shhh!  Ixnay, Dr Crane...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_mildly sarcastic_] Ah, yes.  You've really dropped the cone of silence now.  Anyway, I have delivered on my promise: the talent is behind you.  If you strike, we strike.  All for one and one for all!

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay!  So who is our spokesperson - who is leading the charge?

speaker: Noel
text: I am - you want to make something of it? [_to himself_] Oh shoot, I smiled again! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Rozalinda, a word.  _He gestures towards the studio and leaves for it; Roz follows him.  CUT TO: the studio as she enters and Frasier closes the door, separating them from the staffers._

speaker: Frasier
text: Our leader is Noel Shempsky?!  The man has all the backbone of a paramecium!

speaker: Roz
text: Well, do you think that it's _my_ idea?  Noel and I were the only two who volunteered.  'Course, they voted me down.  I'm smarter than he is, more confident, more articulate, [_hot- headed_] but those stupid little WUSSES think I'm a HOT-HEAD!

speaker: Frasier
text: But Noel, Roz!  A lot of people's jobs are riding on this - including mine!

speaker: Roz
text: Then you do it!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_worried_] Me?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_very worried_] No no, me?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, please!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_panicky_] Me?  No, no, I've done enough already, oh...  _They are interrupted by an irritating knocking on the door of Roz's booth.  Frasier opens it._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry_] What? _Noel enters with what he hopes is resolve.  Behind him, some staffers peep through the doorway._

speaker: Noel
text: Dr Crane, I can see that you're concerned about my negotiating skills.  But don't be - I have a secret weapon: I can faint at will.  Check it out... _He collapses, hitting the floor with a loud bump, and he does not get up.  Roz and the others stare at him; Frasier makes a decision._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the staffers_] Okay people, there's been a coup.  I am now your leader!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_points_] To the lair of the She-Wolf!  _They leave via Roz's booth.  CUT TO: outside Kate's office as a militant crowd of staffers, now led by a determined-looking Frasier, march in.  Kate enters from her office and is slightly taken aback._

speaker: Kate
text: Wow.  What have we here?

speaker: Frasier
text: We are dissatisfied with the wage freeze and we demand to speak to you about it. [_to the crowd_] Don't we?

speaker: Kate
text: Alright, but aren't you people still on the clock?  _The crowd agrees.  And leaves immediately, abandoning Frasier to a bemused Kate._

speaker: Kate
text: Well hi-ho the dairy-o, the cheese stands alone.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_affecting unconcern_] They're a shrewd group.  They only flex their muscles when they have to. [_shouts to the off-screen staffers_] Well done!

speaker: Kate
text: [_amused_] Yeah, right.  Will you get in here? _She enters her office and is followed by Frasier.  CUT TO: the office. Kate sits on the front of her desk as Frasier closes the door._

speaker: Kate
text: I'm kinda surprised to see you here.  This really isn't your fight, is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_proud_] I am honoured to have been chosen by my colleagues to speak for them.

speaker: Kate
text: Oh.  That's a shame.  I was kinda looking forward to seeing Shempsky faint.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we have a lot to do, so we may as well just get to it... [_gazes at Kate_] Is that a, a new hairdo?  It's very fetching.

speaker: Kate
text: [_gazes at Frasier; mildly sarcastic_] Oooh, is that a new tie? It just lights up your pretty face.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_frustrated_] Look, what is it about us?  I mean, why all this friction between us?  For my own part, your intolerable smugness reminds me of my ex-wife.  But... what is the source of your antipathy toward me?  Was there some intimidating male figure in your childhood?  A father?  A, a priest?  A department store Santa... I don't know, I'm just spit-balling here!

speaker: Kate
text: I have an idea about the source of our antagonism.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smug_] Good.  Do let me hear it.

speaker: Kate
text: I'm a woman, I'm as smart as you, and I'm your boss.

speaker: Frasier
text: Coincidences, all!

speaker: Kate
text: Doc... I don't want to analyse your hang-ups.  I already got a full-time job.  Let's just get down to business, okay? _She goes around to the other side of her desk and sits in her swivel chair._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, very well.  There's really very little to discuss. These people were promised a raise.  They have fulfilled their part of the bargain; it's time for you to honour yours.  You have twenty-four hours.

speaker: Kate
text: Or?

speaker: Frasier
text: We walk, _en masse_.  Including the on-air talent.  I've seen to that myself.

speaker: Kate
text: You have.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mmm-hm.

speaker: Kate
text: [_suddenly fed-up_] Why are you gunning for me?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry_] Gunning?  For you?  This isn't about you, it's about what you're doing to those people.  It's the shame of Seattle!

speaker: Kate
text: No, no; this is about your ego, which is the SIZE of Seattle! Every suggestion, every decision I've made has been met by this impenetrable wall of arrogance masquerading as righteousness.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh ho ho ho ho, that's a desperate shot - attacking me because I have a social conscience!

speaker: Kate
text: No, what you have is a fat contract, and so do the rest of your cronies.  So when it came time for staff raises, there was no more money left in the till!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_incensed_] Oh, you are twisting things to make it look like it's my fault! [_stands up_] Oh, it's true what they say: the devil comes disguised as a beautiful woman!  _Frasier and Kate are now in a stand-off over the desk.  Their altercation becomes increasingly passionate, in more ways than one._

speaker: Kate
text: [_stands up too_] There would've been raises if you hadn't taken all the money to pay for those Armani suits.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, what about you?  Let's not overlook that pricey little Fendi scarf you're wearing!

speaker: Kate
text: Well, what about this designer cologne on you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how about those pouty lips that must have cost you a fortune in collagen injections!

speaker: Kate
text: These lips are mine, you arrogant gasbag!

speaker: Frasier
text: You intractable despot!

speaker: Kate
text: BLOWHARD!

speaker: Frasier
text: TYRANT!!

speaker: Kate
text: ASS!!!

speaker: Frasier
text: SHREW!!!! _Suddenly they grab each other and kiss, violently.  Kate grabs the lapels of Frasier's jacket and pushes him away._

speaker: Kate
text: [_breathless_] Get out...! _But she pulls him close and they kiss, again.  Kate pushes Frasier away once more._

speaker: Kate
text: [_distraught_] _Now_! _Frasier rushes to the door, stops for a moment to glance back in horror, and then leaves.  Kate slumps over her desk.  FADE TO:_  **I DRAW THE LINE AT BLANCHE DUBOIS**  _Scene Two - Frasier's apartment. Martin and Daphne are present.  The doorbell rings and Martin goes to open the door; it is Niles, and he looks like a nervous wreck._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_stumbles in_] Maris found a grey hair.

speaker: Martin
text: [_closes the door_] Daphne, get Niles a brandy.  _Daphne does so.  Niles sits down on the couch as Martin heads for The Armchair._

speaker: Niles
text: It was right at the apex of her widow's peak.

speaker: Martin
text: Better bring the bottle! [_sits in The Armchair_]

speaker: Niles
text: She blames me, dad.  She said it's from the stress I caused her last night when I thoughtlessly turned on the light while she was getting undressed. _Daphne hands Niles a glass of brandy, along with the bottle, and sits next to him on the couch armrest.  Then, a worried-looking Frasier enters through the front door.  Daphne gets up and goes to him enthusiastically._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Frasier_] Oh!  Good evening, Dr Crane!  Oh, let me take that for you. [_takes his coat and goes to hang it up_] After all, you are the friend of the working man!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Defender of the little people...

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_hanging Frasier's coat on the hook_] Standing up to the boss on behalf of the downtrodden, selflessly risking your own...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_loses his temper_] Don't you have some meat to boil?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_calms down_] I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I apologise, it's just been a, a, a bad day.  I was elected by the employees to present our demands to, to Kate.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh well, that was a smart move!  Did you give her a good tongue-lashing?

speaker: Frasier
text: In a manner of speaking, yes.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm proud of you, son.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, don't be, dad - I'm a fraud.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_depressed_] I, I was in her office... tempers flared and, the next thing I knew, we were...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...locked in a... passionate kiss!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_intrigued_] Ooooh, go on!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_slightly embarrassed_] Daphne, I'm really not that comfortable talking about this in front of you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no need to be shy around me.  I'm a professional health care worker!  I've seen it all!  I've helped your father in and out of the bathtub.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: I've seen his bits!

speaker: Martin
text: [_outraged_] Hey!  Oh, for God's sake! [_to Frasier_] Just tell her, will you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, alright.  It was like nothing I've ever experienced before, it was just... pure sex!  Overwhelming, unexpected, animal-like!

speaker: Niles
text: [_sarcastic_] Oh well, that!  We've all experienced that, who hasn't?  Pfff!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm no stranger to that feeling meself. [_goes to the couch_] It can strike without warning.  And you don't know who it will be! [_sits on the armrest again_] Why, you could be standing next to a person [_gestures towards Niles_] month after month, and then the next thing you know, you're tearing each other's clothes off!  There's a word for it...

speaker: Niles
text: [_to himself_] Hope.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hmmm?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this is madness!  I'm actually lusting after a woman that does nothing but grate on my nerves.  I can't stand her!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh really, Dr Crane!  Would a man want to have sex with a woman he doesn't even like?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thoughtful_] What about her?  Maybe she's been harbouring feelings for me.  Is it possible that she could have been lusting after me all this time?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it could be.  But... you know, you were in the middle of a negotiation.  Maybe she laid that smackeroo on you just to rattle your brain.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad has a point.  Your musk-drenched animal magnetism aside, it's quite possible that she was simply manipulating you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I hardly think so. [_smiles_] The woman's passion... seemed genuine.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_knowingly_] Yes - it always does. [_gets up and goes to the dining table_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you suppose it's possible she's just using sex to sway me to her side?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, figure it out.  Who made the first move?  You or her?

speaker: Frasier
text: There was no first move.  It was more like spontaneous sexual combustion.

speaker: Martin
text: There's always a first move.  Think.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright.  I was standing in front of her desk like so. [_walks up to the coffee table in front of Niles_] She was facing me... Niles, you be Kate.

speaker: Niles
text: [_insulted_] I will not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, just stand up!

speaker: Niles
text: [_exasperated_] I'm always the girl!  In every prep school play I was the girl!  Guinevere, Marian the Librarian, Ado Annie. Well, no more, I'm through with it!  When do I get to be Shoeless Joe from Hannibal, Mo'?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angry_] This is getting me nowhere! [_goes for his coat_] Alright.  I'll just have to go down there and confront her myself. [_grabs his coat and wears it, while walking to the door_] Find out if what she was feeling was actually genuine or she was simply being a conniving femme fatale!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come on now, Dr Crane!  It's not like men have never used sex to get what they want.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_annoyed_] How can we possibly USE sex to get what we want?! Sex IS what we want! _He exits, leaving the two remaining males nodding their heads and the female even more dismayed.  FADE TO:_  _Scene Three - KACL; Kate's office. Kate is alone behind her desk, facing away from the door and looking through some papers.  Her jacket is off and her bare arms are now visible.  Someone knocks on the door; it is Frasier, and he peeps in timidly. Kate glances at him, nervous.  She slowly turns to face him as he creeps into the room and quietly closes the door.  At the beginning their conversation is conducted awkwardly and from opposite ends of the room._

speaker: Frasier
text: Kate.

speaker: Kate
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Er... I think we have some issues to discuss.

speaker: Kate
text: Me too.  Have a seat.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd prefer to stand.

speaker: Kate
text: Me too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's talk about the kiss.

speaker: Kate
text: Yeah.  Let's.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright.  Why did it happen?  Some possibilities: [_sidles up to the desk_] Er, frustration; passion; the stress of the situation; [_pauses meaningfully_] Manipulation.

speaker: Kate
text: [_intrigued_] Manipulation... that is interesting.

speaker: Frasier
text: What's interesting is that you focused on manipulation. Why...?

speaker: Kate
text: Because there's a possibility of manipulation.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_triumphant_] So, you admit that you were manipulating me!

speaker: Kate
text: Me?  I'm talking about you!  How dare you think I'd do a thing like that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not unheard of for a woman like you to use her feminine wiles to get what she wants.

speaker: Kate
text: Oh, very clever!  What about you using your masculine wiles to get what you want?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quietly_] You think my wiles are masculine?

speaker: Kate
text: No, I am not going down that road again.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_smug_] 'Course you're not.  Because at the end of that road is a cul-de-sac of vulnerability.  That's not you, is it? No, you're cement-hard.

speaker: Kate
text: [_incredulous_] "Cul-de-sac of vulnerability"? [_fed-up_] Alright, listen.  You see me for a couple of hours out of every day, and you think you know me?  The _me_ me?  Alright, I can be tough - okay, I've gotta be.  I can also be tender... spontaneous... shy... lusty... playful.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_turned on_] Kittenish?

speaker: Kate
text: I could climb _you_ like a scratching post.

speaker: Frasier/Kate
text: [_excited, then:_] Damn it!  _It's kissing time again.  Kate leaps onto her desk and kneels upon it, snogging Frasier.  Now it is Frasier's turn to disengage._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_distraught_] Stop!  What are we doing?! [_goes to the door_] Now... there are people out there counting on us!  _Kate moves off her desk and stands in front of it, rearranging her clothing._

speaker: Kate
text: Right, you're absolutely right.  We've gotta put personal pleasure aside until we get this thing resolved.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_determined_] Absolutely.  We owe it to them.  If it takes every minute of every hour of every day, and every ounce of strength we have, we have got to settle this strike! [_claps his hands together_] Alright.  Those people deserve a five percent raise.

speaker: Kate
text: I'll give you three.

speaker: Frasier
text: Four!

speaker: Kate
text: Done.  _They kiss.  Embracing each other, they stumble up against the desk; Frasier sweeps some items off and they fall on top of it, still kissing.  CUT TO: outside at the same time.  Plenty of KACL staffers and personalities, among them Gil and Noel, are standing around, waiting anxiously; Roz has her ear to the door of Kate's office. Bulldog enters from the corridor._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, any news?

speaker: Roz
text: [_takes her ear away, pleased_] Frasier's hanging tough!  He just keeps pounding that desk and saying, "More, more, more!"

speaker: Bulldog
text: Okay! _The staffers cheer.  The door to Kate's office opens just a crack and Frasier slips out, looking furtive and somewhat dishevelled.  He closes the door and keeps his back to it while addressing the crowd._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good news - she's offered three percent.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, never!  I'm going to get you four!  I don't care if I have to stay in there all night!  _He goes back in.  The assembled staffers and personalities cheer him on and, led by Gil, chant his name: "FRASIER, FRASIER, FRASIER!"_  **TO BE CONTINUED...**
